name: War Room, (New York City R&D Division), The Offshore Firm (2021)
description:
"War Room, (New York City R&D Division)"
The Offshore Firm (2021)

////////// A sharply-dressed man named Fukuyama opens the door to welcome you. "This is where we play war games," he explains, "It doesn't matter where a conflict takes place, our computers can predict enemy movements with a stunning degree of accuracy." You wonder what exactly Mr. Fukuyama is trying to sell you, but this is New York City, where everything is for sale. Through the office window you can see the towers gleaming. In this exact light the city looks eternal. /////////

Metarealistic game photography depicting hypercorporate, antisocial, and sometimes liminal virtual environments.

This photographed scene was created using "The Life Stage: Virtual House," a building design simulator released in 1993 for the 3DO console.

Although the game has fallen into obscurity, it was notably ahead of its time for its use of photographic gameplay elements within an immersive 3D virtual space.

// Artwork by Sabato Visconti // www.sabatobox.com // @sabatobox on IG //
